newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia says okays $6.3 bln foreign investment.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia says okays $6.3 bln foreign investment.

text.p: Indonesian Investment Minister Sanyoto Sastrowardoyo said on Monday 1997 foreign investment approvals until March 15 totalled $6.3 billion, compared with $6.94 billion in the first two months of 1996.

Sanyoto told reporters after meeting President Suharto that in the first 36 months of the sixth five-year plan up to March Indonesia had approved $1.6 trillion of foreign investment, adding 53.8 percent of the investment was realised in this period.
He added this was two times the amount approved during the entire length of the fifth five-year plan which lasted from April 1, 1989, the start of the 1989/90 fiscal year, until March 31, 1994.
In the period in 1997 to March 15, Sanyoto said most of the foreign investment was in the chemicals sector with 24 projects accounting for $3.9 billion.
Other investment was in the manufacturing, tourism and retail sectors, he added, with giving further details.
